This posting is in respect to the problem I was having
where my code compiled fine against Heritrix 1.3.0, but
at runtime could not find the AList methods that have 
been moved into Candidate URI.

St. Ack wrote in message 1400 (Jan. 21, 2005):

> Its as though your runtime is using an old jar.

He is right!  Although heritrix-1.3.0.jar was at the front 
of my CLASSPATH, it turns out that Heritrix gets its jarfile
via the $HERITRIX_HOME environment variable, which I had not 
bothered to reset from heritrix-1.2.0/.

I fleshed out the heritrix-1.3.0/ directory with bin/ and conf/
and then repointed $HERITRIX_HOME to it.  All is now well.

St. Ack also asked:

> if I try and shove the parent CrawlURI into the 
> CandidateURI#alist using putObject, I get serialization 
> exceptions out of BdbFrontier when it schedules/queues 
> the resulting CrawlURI. Being able to add any old 'Object' 
> to a CandidateURI/CrawlURI is just asking for trouble.
> Is this going to be a problem for you?

No problem.  I am copying only basic ints, floats, & strings 
from CrawlURI to CandidateURI.  

Many thanks to Michael Stack for making all those code changes
(and very promptly, too!) to allow the possibility of parent
CrawlURIs passing information to its child CandidateURIs.  In
the long run I suspect it will be a plus to have AList hidden
from us; calling "put"s and "get"s right on the URIs is neat.
Also, the overridable Postselector.createCandidateURI is in
fact a very elegant way to minimize the amount of Postselector
that needs to be overridden by a subclass of it.

bergmark_d, happy camper.
